page.title: 06SOCIAL CONCERNS SCRAPTOFT
page.content: As well as removing hedges and ploughing up medieval stripland, a local builder has ploughed over an area of badger sets.Badgers had already being suffering cruelty according to local newspaper reports, from people taking part in badger baiting.Badgers were being dug out of their sets,their lower jaw being broken before being set on by several dogs. Fox hunting in the area has also caused some controversy with public opinion divided on its merits as the most efficient method of pest control, and cruelty to animals.It has been said that if foxhunting was abolished, then the coverts and copses would also disappear as farmers would convert them to farmland with tragic results for wildlife.
